title: Immigration Medical Exam Fast Guide - UPDATED August 2022 -
author: Sunshine State Medical
description: New Changes to the form and requirements are due at the end of May 2023. U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is removing the requirement that civil surgeons must sign Form I-693, Report of Immigration Medical Examination and Vaccination Record, no more than 60 days before an individual applies for an underlying immigration benefit As of October 1, 2021, every person trying to adjust their status will need proof of Covid 19 Vaccine. There are exceptions for kids with health conditions and religious reasons.
cleaned_text: The Immigration Medical Exam is required for all filing form [I-485 (Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status](https://www.uscis.gov/i-485). Once you have your "Green Card," you can become a citizen in 3 - 5 years, depending on your case. Vaccines have an extensive range in price. Our office has access to verify your information within the FloridaShot portal and obtain a full report, and avoid unnecessary vaccines costs at no additional charge. Here is the current list of vaccine requirements directly from the USCIS website. "Under the immigration laws of the United States, a foreign national who applies for an immigrant visa abroad, or who seeks to adjust status to a permanent resident while in the United States, is required to receive vaccinations to prevent the following diseases: If you have been vaccinated within the last 10 years. we can request a blood titer test to see if the antibodies are present in your blood For MMR and/or Varicella. *Keep in mind that if the antibody levels are low in your blood, Immigration will require that you get vaccinated again* If you need all vaccines, you need to get them simultaneously, or you will have to wait 30 days or more to complete your shots due to the active nature of some vaccines.
